@RealSaidov Hydrogen compliments solar/wind. IMHO it can grow more renewables demand than batteries. It couples sectors. It is stored energy with long duration and volumes. Low risk mineral supply chain. The 'hydricity' mental model helps. My hill: we can't electrify without molecules

@RealSaidov Yes, catalysts improve efficiency but IMHO the last lens to use in energy assessments is efficiency. Our grid inputs/outputs is <50% wasted heat. ICE (engines) 25%. Better lenses around utility (capacity factor; dispatchability) and value creation.

Reminder that solar, wind and batteries are not made by organic coops who pay a fair wage. They involve minerals extraction, labor abuse, toxic pollution, GHG emissions, clashing geopolitical powers (try getting solar outside China), bribery-corruption and global interdependence.
